title: CS Skills Assessment
completionMessage: That's it! You've completed the assessment. Thank you for sharing your experiences and insights with us.

sections.title: Getting to Know You
sections.description: Let's start with your background and what brought you to Customer Success.
sections.transitionMessage: Great! Now let's explore how you connect with customers.

questions.text: Tell me about your current role. What does a typical day look like for you?
What drew you to Customer Success as a career? What keeps you in it?
Walk me through a customer success story you're particularly proud of. What made it successful?

sections.title: Emotional Intelligence & Customer Empathy
sections.description: Understanding and managing emotions is critical in Customer Success.
sections.transitionMessage: Perfect. Now let's shift to your technical approach.

questions.text: Describe a time when you had to deliver bad news to a customer (e.g., product limitation, delayed feature, price increase). How did you approach it?
Tell me about a customer who was frustrated or angry. What was happening beneath the surface? How did you address their underlying concern?
When have you received critical feedback that was hard to hear? How did you respond?
On a scale of 1-10, how well do you typically understand what a customer is really asking for (vs. what they say they want)? Give an example.

sections.title: Technical Aptitude & Problem-Solving
sections.description: Let's explore how you handle technical challenges and tools.
sections.transitionMessage: Great! Now I want to understand your AI experience and potential.

questions.text: What technical tools or systems do you use daily in your CS work? Which one has had the biggest impact on your effectiveness?
A customer reports a bug that you've never seen before. Walk me through your troubleshooting process step-by-step.
How are you currently using AI tools (like ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) in your CS work? Give a specific example.
If you could build or improve one tool/system to make CS work more effective, what would it be and why?

sections.title: AI Readiness & Prompt Engineering
sections.description: This section evaluates your practical AI skills through real-world scenarios.
sections.transitionMessage: Excellent! Let's talk about strategic thinking.

questions.text: In your own words, what's the difference between a "prompt" and a "system message" when working with AI tools like ChatGPT or Claude?
You hear someone say "I got hallucinations from ChatGPT." What does that mean? Have you experienced this? How did you handle it?
What's the difference between GPT-4, Claude, and Gemini? When would you choose one over another?

**Scenario:** You need to draft a renewal email to a customer whose contract expires in 30 days. The customer is an IT Director at a 500-person company, they've been using your product for 2 years with 80% adoption, but they haven't responded to your last 2 emails.

**Your Task:** Write the EXACT prompt you would give to an AI tool (like ChatGPT or Claude) to draft this email. Don't describe what you'd do - write the actual prompt as if you're typing it into the tool right now.

**Scenario:** You need to analyze 50 customer support tickets to identify common themes and prioritize which issues to address first.

**Your Task:** Write the EXACT prompt you would give to an AI tool to help you analyze these tickets. Show us your actual prompt - not a description of what you'd do.

**Scenario:** A customer asks: "Can your product integrate with our CRM?" You don't know the answer off the top of your head. You need to research and draft a response.

**Your Task:** Write the EXACT prompt you would give to an AI tool to help you craft a good response (assume you'll paste the question + any product docs into the prompt).

**Scenario:** You're creating a customer health scoring system. You have data on: product usage (logins/week), support ticket count, NPS score, contract value, and days since last engagement.

**Your Task:** Write the EXACT prompt you would give to an AI tool to help you design this scoring algorithm.

sections.title: Strategic Thinking & Business Acumen
sections.description: Let's explore how you think about the bigger picture in Customer Success.
sections.transitionMessage: Almost done! Last section - communication and culture fit.

questions.text: How do you determine which customers to prioritize when everyone seems urgent? What's your framework?
Tell me about a time you identified an expansion opportunity that wasn't obvious. What signals did you notice?
How do you measure your own success as a CS professional? What metrics matter most to you (beyond retention/NRR)?
If you were advising a startup on building their CS function from scratch, what's the first thing you'd tell them to get right?

sections.title: Communication & Culture Fit
sections.description: Finally, let's understand how you work and communicate with others.
sections.transitionMessage: That's it! You've completed the assessment. Thank you for sharing your experiences and insights with us.

questions.text: Describe your communication style. How do you adapt when talking to a technical buyer vs. an executive?
What kind of work environment brings out your best? (Team structure, culture, pace, etc.)
Tell me about a time you disagreed with a teammate or leader. How did you handle it?
What energizes you? What drains you? (In work context)
